column5: Biggest Largie... caught on an 80 acre lake in south western ontario... 23 inches head to toe - caught on a wacky rigged sink worm about an hour before sunrise on september 4th   Biggest Smallies... lake erie piggies... tube jigs
My PB came this Fall on Simcoe -- a 6 lb 13 oz smallie on a minnowbait.
not sure how heavy it was (~22 inches), but i'm sure it will get bigger and bigger as i get older!

A 23.5 inch largemouth on a chartreuse spinner bait many years ago.  Very heavy in the 7 pound range.  A 23 inch simcoe smallie that was in the high 6's.... I have the pictures around here somewhere.....  Both won me In-fisherman Master Angler for there year.
7.2 pounds on the scale in the boat 6.78 on the tourny scale at the weigh in after being in the livewell caught this summer on Lake Erie
7 lbs. 8 oz. Carrollton GA    Pikeslayer
5lb OOS accident.. sigh
stupid incidental fish hitting a muskie lure - one of the bigger ones i've caught    no idea what it weighed or its dimensions
One of the bigger smallmouth i caught in Pigeon Lake.   Summer of 2009 while trying for bass.
I remember that post!  I fish Tri Lakes quite a bit and have weighed in a few nice smallies, but none over 5. That IS a trophy fish for that lake or from the other two lakes connected.
It was between 6 and 6.5lbs caught on a black/blue tube on lake simcoe.

In my opinion it is very hard to guess the weight of large bass.  A number of years ago a friend and I won a small tournament where we had five fish that I would have sworn were all 4.5 or 5 pounds... At the weigh-in our biggest fish was under 4 pounds!  Since then I  have caught, and weighed, several LMBass in the 5 pound range.  These fish are generally about 24 inches long, and much bigger than what you often see called five pounds on TV...This one weighed 5.5  pounds and hit a generic Senko type worm on ten pound, red Powerpro, with no leader.    The largest LMBass I have caught, in season, was last Opening Day, in the rain, with Albert, aka "HTHM."    This fish weighed in at 7.3 pounds on a digital scale and hit a green Yum Buzz Frog, on 20 pound mono, in heavy weeds.  Here's a picture of the same fish taken as Albert lifted it out of the net.  I think the actual size is more apparent in this shot.   Garry2R's
like 4.5lbs boo! not even worth mentioning in this thread, those some massive bass!
6.4 lbs on a wacky rig.
Here is a picture of my pig..... Garry that 7lb largie is amazing man...congrads big time
Good guess! (FLA)
my biggest was a 6.7 lb Smallie out of scugog. on an xrap. had some just shy of that in the 5 & 6 lb range. my good friend caught a nice 7.1 on a frog two years ago.

i've boated a 7.5 lb smallie on lake st.francis...  the beast was 24 inches long...  i was fishing muskie and the bass took down a 8-10 inch minnow...i couldnt believe it  the next day...same thing happened again with a 6lb smallie... then it never happened again  sorry boys...no pic... it was before i got my first digital camera
This is my only "true" 5 pounder, caught on a smaller north Kawartha lake a few years ago:
About 7#'s caught on a live leopard frog out in front of This Dump back in the 80's

231/2" largemouth from a small lake in Haliburton.  On one of my solo jaunts to Quetico park I caught 5 smallmouth on consecutive casts over 5lb's. Biggest was 6 and change. (If you're a bass guy I know some lakes in that park that'd melt your brain.  )

Caught this Nov on Lake Simcoe with a dropshotted worm. 7 lbs 10 oz Solopaddler, Quetico is on my bucket list of places to fish for smallmouth. Do you think the fishing is still as good there as in the past? Would it be better in the spring or fall?
Smallmouth 7.3 lbs on Lake Erie.
Over 6 pd smallie caught on Balsam Lake. She hit my muskie spinner so hard.
A Smallie just over 20". Caught on a Flame Red Original Hot n Tot.
Spinnerbait on Severn River
Mine was about 8 inches,less than a pound and caught on worms at Lake Scugog. LOL
6.7lbs on a 7" power worm

I caught a 6lb LMB using a hula popper on Loch Garry near Alexandria, way back before they killed the lake by draining too much water into the city reservoir.The lake froze right to the bottom, killing everything in it.
5Lbs 6oz LMB and measured 21 1/2" on surface, jitterbug leopard green color pattern Leechman
19" 4.5lbs on sparrow lake(pre-spawn) on a 5" green/watermelon senko
7lbs 2 oz Smallie on the St. lawrence river a few years ago.  ^lbs 5 oz largie on a secret lake a bit north a couple of years ago.  Now I'm lucky if I catch a bass that is bigger than my lure.....
6lb 14oz Largemouth out of a lake on the Trent. Caught it on 10lb mono and a Rapala Skitter pop....Last August
5lb 8oz Largemouth in the Kawarthas.  Lots around 5lb. but tough to get one over 5.
I might have caught a nickel largemouth when I didnt really care or think of weighing 2 years ago. But for now a legit 4.8lb smallmouth on a Strike King Series 5 sexy shad
6lb 3oz smallie, caught on watermelon sinking worm... I thought I was snagged, and then the "snag" took off like a freight train  25" long and 17" around    same fish to add some perspective >>

I've caught bigger, but this is my most memorable. Over 30 years ago... I don't feel old enough to say that.  The fair haired one is my brother who's got about  100lbs on me now.  Lake Nipissing caught on a green rubber frog
Mine was a 4.9lb smallie on Simcoe last summer. So close to a nickle but yet so far...
mine was 4.5 lb's on a small lake in  London although my dad has caught some bigger ones
I have one smallie that weighed 7 on an old scale.  Hard to sale just how big it was.  I have a couple at 6 and several 5 pounders.
My largest was around 7       cm's
You can make that sucker look like a 3 pounder by holding your arm out....WAYYYYYYYYYY out.
3.2lbs Small...Port elgin
I never knew you were so huge !!! i better watch myself.

mine is OH SO CLOSE to that.  5.4 on a jitterbug at night in the same pattern.  all others have not been measured due to many reasons but I think I broke that mark this year on Lake X.  I will be gunning for the 7LB mark for my next target.  I know I've come close to 6 or just over but no scale at the time...
9 lbs 6 oz
A few hundred between 19-22 inches,  but never enough of them when I needed them to make any serious money off of them.

I think that GBFISHER has got me beat   My P/B Smallie is 6.9lbs caught on a Yellow Jig and Clam Guts  My P/B Largie is 7.9Lbs caught OOS by accident on a Firetiger Williams Wabler while fishing for Pike.  Randy
What a cow!!!!  Where did you catch that?  I'm guessing not anywhere in Canada?

34 lbs caught on chesapeake bay... that's my pb striped bass LOL  as for LMB, this was my PB, that I estimate between 5-6, it was 21" http://www.ofncommunity.com/forums/index.php?app=core&module=attach&section=attach&attach_rel_module=post&attach_id=14502
